episodeTitle: A Big Clash! The Straw Hats vs. A Hundred Thousand Enemies!
episodeTitleJapanese: 大激突！麦わら一味VS10万の敵
episodeTitleRomanized: Dai Gekitotsu! Mugiwara Ichimi tai Jū-Man no Teki
description: Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates face off against Hody Jones and his massive army at Gyoncorde Plaza. A flashback reveals Jinbe's strategic plan involving the crew. In a stunning display of power, Luffy unleashes his Conqueror's Haki to knock out 50,000 enemies, declaring his intention to become King of the Pirates.

events.title: Jinbe's Strategic Plan Revealed
events.description: A flashback reveals Jinbe's coordinated plan with the Straw Hats. Jinbe would be captured voluntarily with Megalo (hiding Luffy inside) as a distraction, while Nami would steal the Celestial Dragon's letter and Robin would free the royal family with the keys.
events.significance: Demonstrates the strategic coordination between Jinbe and the Straw Hat Pirates, showing their teamwork and planning abilities before the major confrontation.

quotes.text: I wanted to portray you as a hero while dealing with Hody Jones for the sake of the citizens and their future.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Explaining the plan to Luffy in the flashback

events.title: Luffy Refuses to be a Hero
events.description: In the flashback, Jinbe suggests Luffy become the hero of Fish-Man Island. Luffy initially refuses, stating that pirates can never be heroes, but Jinbe convinces him by appealing to his desire to help his friends.
events.significance: Reveals an important aspect of Luffy's character - his understanding that pirates aren't heroes - while also showing his willingness to help those he cares about.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's response to Jinbe's suggestion to become a hero

events.title: Nami Steals the Celestial Dragon's Letter
events.description: The flashback shows Nami successfully using her mirage abilities to steal the Celestial Dragon's letter and the keys to Neptune's chains, then passing the letter to Shirahoshi - the hope that Queen Otohime had left behind.
events.significance: Shows Nami's stealth skills and completes part of Jinbe's plan, recovering Queen Otohime's important letter.

events.title: Robin Frees the Royal Family
events.description: Robin uses her Devil Fruit powers to unlock the chains binding King Neptune and the princes from a distance, using the keys Nami obtained.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's tactical use of her Hana Hana no Mi abilities and frees the royal family from captivity.

events.title: Zoro, Usopp, and Brook's Escape from the Palace
events.description: A flashback reveals how Pappag helped Zoro, Usopp, and Brook escape from their cage in the flooded palace. Pappag brings Zoro his swords, which he uses to slash the chains and cage. The trio then escapes and is picked up by the Thousand Sunny.
events.significance: Explains how the three Straw Hats escaped captivity and rejoined their crew for the final battle.

quotes.text: I had some trouble freeing them because they nearly scared me to death!
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Explaining to Luffy how he freed the three Straw Hats

events.title: Hody Jones Reveals His Ambitions
events.description: Hody Jones reveals his tyrannical goals: to become king of Fish-Man Island, kill all human kings at the Reverie (World Summit), establish a terrifying underwater kingdom, expand slavery, and become King of the Pirates.
events.significance: Establishes Hody as a major antagonist with world-threatening ambitions and reveals the scope of his hatred and plans.

quotes.text: I will become king of this island, kill all human kings at the World Summit, and become King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Declaring his ambitions to the crowd and the Straw Hats

events.title: Hody's Hatred of Humans Revealed
events.description: Hody berates Jinbe for working with humans despite Fisher Tiger and Arlong's suffering at human hands, revealing the deep-seated prejudice and hatred that drives him.
events.significance: Provides context for Hody's extreme views and highlights the cycle of hatred that Jinbe and the Straw Hats are trying to break.

events.title: Luffy Unleashes Conqueror's Haki
events.description: Luffy walks toward Hody's approaching army and unleashes a massive burst of Conqueror's Haki (Supreme King Haki/Haoshoku Haki), instantly knocking out approximately 50,000 of the 100,000 enemy forces. The New Fish-Man Pirates are shocked by this overwhelming display of willpower.
events.significance: This is one of the most iconic demonstrations of Luffy's Conqueror's Haki, showcasing his growth during the two-year time skip and his ability to control this rare power. It proves he has the qualities of a king and dramatically shifts the battle odds.

events.title: The Straw Hats Confront the New Fish-Man Pirates
events.description: With half of Hody's forces eliminated, the Straw Hat Pirates prepare to engage in battle against the remaining New Fish-Man Pirates and their army at Gyoncorde Plaza.
events.significance: Marks the official beginning of the major battle between the Straw Hats and the New Fish-Man Pirates that will determine the fate of Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Luffy Declares Only One Can Be King of the Pirates
events.description: Luffy slowly walks toward Hody Jones and declares that there can only be one King of the Pirates, directly challenging Hody's ambitions and asserting his own dream.
events.significance: Reinforces Luffy's unwavering determination to achieve his dream and sets up the ideological clash between Luffy's pursuit of freedom and Hody's pursuit of power through hatred.

quotes.text: There can only be one King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration as he walks toward Hody

quotes.text: There can only be one King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Declaring his determination to Hody Jones

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Refusing Jinbe's suggestion to become a hero

quotes.text: I wanted to portray you as a hero while dealing with Hody Jones for the sake of the citizens and their future.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe

quotes.text: I will become king of this island, kill all human kings at the World Summit, and become King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones

themes.description: Luffy's use of Conqueror's Haki demonstrates that true leadership comes from overwhelming willpower, not just physical strength. His ability to knock out 50,000 enemies without throwing a punch shows the power of his spirit.
themes.symbolism: The Conqueror's Haki represents Luffy's inner strength and his natural ability to inspire and lead others.

themes.description: Luffy's insistence that pirates can never be heroes reveals his understanding of his own nature, while also showing that he will still protect those he cares about regardless of titles.
themes.symbolism: The distinction between pirate and hero highlights the moral complexity of the One Piece world.

themes.description: The conflict between Jinbe's cooperation with humans and Hody's hatred of them represents the central theme of the arc - whether the cycle of prejudice can be broken.
themes.symbolism: Hody represents the perpetuation of hatred, while Jinbe and the Straw Hats represent the possibility of understanding and cooperation.

themes.description: The flashbacks show how the Straw Hats worked together with Jinbe to execute a complex plan, demonstrating their growth as a coordinated crew.
themes.symbolism: Each crew member's role in the plan showcases their unique strengths and their trust in one another.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows the results of his two-year training by demonstrating masterful control over his Conqueror's Haki, a power he could barely understand before the time skip. He also reveals his philosophy about pirates and heroes.
keyActions: Refuses to be called a hero
Unleashes Conqueror's Haki to knock out 50,000 enemies
Declares there can only be one King of the Pirates
quotes: There can only be one King of the Pirates!

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe demonstrates his tactical mind and his desire to help Fish-Man Island by coordinating the Straw Hats' actions. His willingness to work with humans contrasts with Hody's hatred.
keyActions: Devises the strategic plan for the crew
Convinces Luffy to help despite his reluctance to be a hero
Gets captured as part of the plan
quotes: I wanted to portray you as a hero while dealing with Hody Jones for the sake of the citizens and their future.

characterSpotlights.development: Hody's true ambitions and the depth of his hatred are fully revealed, establishing him as a villain driven by prejudice and a lust for power.
keyActions: Reveals his plan to kill human kings at the World Summit
Declares his intention to become King of the Pirates
Berates Jinbe for working with humans
quotes: I will become king of this island, kill all human kings at the World Summit, and become King of the Pirates!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the flashback sequences showing Jinbe's plan and the individual crew members' actions compared to the manga's more condensed presentation.
The anime adds additional reaction shots from the New Fish-Man Pirates and citizens when Luffy uses Conqueror's Haki.

trivia.fact: This episode marks one of the most iconic uses of Conqueror's Haki in the series, demonstrating Luffy's precise control over the ability after the two-year time skip.
Episode 554 received a TV rating of 10.7%, ranking #3 in viewership when it aired in Japan.

The Conqueror's Haki scene from this episode was later remastered in the One Piece Log: Fish-Man Island Saga special edition in 2024, with visible Haki effects added, which sparked fan debate about whether the invisible force was more impactful.

sources.title: The One Piece Remaster Is Good but It Gets One Thing Wrong About Haki

trivia.fact: This was Luffy's third use of Conqueror's Haki in the anime, following his unconscious use at Marineford (Episode 389) and his demonstration for Fake Luffy's crew (Episode 517).

sources.title: Haki/Supreme King Haki - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Luffy's quote 'Pirates can never be heroes!' became a memorable character-defining moment that fans often reference when discussing Luffy's moral philosophy.
